tossup_question: 26) BIOLOGY  Amino acids are joined to one another in linear polymers that fold to form proteins. What is the name of the chemical bond that joins the amino terminus of one amino acid to the carboxyl terminus of the next amino acid in the sequence?
tossup_answer: ANSWER: PEPTIDE BOND (ACCEPT: PEPTIDE, AMINE BONZ)
bonus_question: 26) BIOLOGY  Name two cellular organelles besides the nucleus that contain a genome.
